text: Nicknamed "Doomballs", these dangerous micro-replicas of the Doomsphere provide Doom-flayers with a potent but unpredictable power source.
Mechanical flaying is a complex business; a Doom-flayer’s parts need constant analysis to stay in sync and to maximise power.
Allows the Warlock Masters to 'plug-in' to their Doom-flayers, redirecting some of the Warp-energy to their own bodies.
What happens when you stick foldable blades onto the ones you already have? An inescapable maelstrom of screaming, agonising, flaying death! Ouch!
Equipping a Doom-flayer with a set of motorized whirling blades gives it the ability to deflect incoming projectiles.
Warpstone-powered incendiary devices triggered around the Doom-flayer are effective countermeasures against anything thrown at them... which is typically an awful lot!
The secret recipe for this black stone alloy results in blades that get sharper and sharper the more they cut and slash.
Similar to the Doomwheel's 'Meat Shields' technique, putrid flesh is used to assault the enemy’s senses as a method of distraction.
Rigorous testing has shown that penetrating these reinforced, serrated armour plates is near-impossible without damaging the penetrating weapon.
An iron ball of death is more effective the less it is dragged down by resistance – be that by wind, blood, flesh, or bone!
These components allow a cyclical energy transfer between the scurrying rats powering the Doomwheel and its Warpstone generator, leading to incredible power surges.
Adding these to a Doomwheel's Warpstone generator allows a Warlock Master to overcharge its power output to unpredictable levels.
A portable power system used for keeping other Doomwheel systems operational when the scurrying rats are at full automotive capacity.
Allows Warp Lightning bolts to be split with a stunning 200% efficiency, using a technique likely 'acquired' from the Luminarks of Nuln.
Using these curiously-designed parts, power transfer can occur at impossible speeds, leading to even more devastating zappers.
Fitted to Doomwheel bolt-throwers, these allow Warp-energy to be briefly stored before firing, making for more concentrated attacks.
Smells like rat-bile mixed with crude oil, but few things are better for keeping engine parts moving – just don’t ask how it’s made.
These parts have long been scavenged from Dwarf-things' Gyrocopters – with modifications, they can also afford the Doomwheels more killing-mileage!
Blending metallurgy, alchemy, and sorcery results in the best armour you can possibly forge. Smells toxic, but what doesn't on a Doomwheel?
Tying up some slaves and suspending them around the Doomwheel provides some level of grisly protection – just keep the flesh fresh!
Research into new bullet designs yields interesting results; all that's needed now is an assembly line of slaves to painstakingly mass-produce them.
This new-fangled invention for ammunition replenishment enables on-the-spot conversion of metal scraps into bullets.
The hotter a Ratling Gun gets, the faster it can fire, but the more liable it is to overheat. Coolant solves this problem.
The Skaven do not have great eyesight, so the sniping ability of Warplock Jezzails benefits greatly from immensely powerful telescopic scopes.
A costly method of manufacturing bullets results in this all-purpose ammunition, effective against all types of armour whenever within killing range.
Invisibility is seemingly a step too far, so the Engineers of Skryre shall devise something they claim is just as good.
A giant labyrinth of pumps, valves, turbines, and generators, all submerged in an ominous cloud of green steam. Here, Warpstone’s power is harvested.
In the filthy caverns of the Under-Empire, the potential for mass destruction shall silently sit, stockpiled until the moment of explosive grandeur.
Devising new 'waste-not, want-not' methods will make even the most degraded or poisonous waste materials processable for Warp-fuel production.
Test subjects are prodded, stabbed, shot, zapped, burnt, dematerialised – you name it. If it causes pain or death, it probably happens here.
Warpstone ore is quite unusable in its crude state, needing processes of separation and purification before being in any way useful.
Give the Doomrockets an extra 'kick'. The enemy’s going to feel this one!
Larger enemy-things can endure globadiers' poisoned winds. But if laced with needle-thin Warpstone shards, even the thickest skin would provide no defence.
If Warpstone gas is passed through a Hell Pit Abomination before bottling, its potency increases dramatically. The specifics of this procedure are best left... undiscussed.
Bombardiers may be fragile, but the Wyrdstone fumes which envelop them are a powerful deterrent. With the right distillation, terror will grip any nearby foe.
The giddying effect of poisoned winds slows the work of Skaven mortar crews. Regularly inhaling these air-globes will grant fresh speed to tired paws.
Warpstone gas rakes flesh, but a strong mind might endure the agony unless the brew is infused with an unspeakable offal found only in the Plague Monks' rancid cells...
As if their lives were not already short and painful from exposure to poison winds, elite mortar crew are forced to stitch focus-enhancing Warpstone gems into their eyes.
A double-barrelled flamethrower has two uses – preventing the weapon from overheating and shooting enemies approaching from two different directions!
Whether handling dangerous materials in the lab or wielding chemical-spewing weaponry in the field, protective attire is always a boon!
With pump designs haphazardly copied from the Dwarfs, the Warpfire Throwers will squirt their toxic filth further than ever before!
When a Warpstone drillbit is flanged with pillaged Gromril, fashioned into crude rat-claw shapes, even the very rock is liquified by its unstoppable passage.
Legend tells that any Clanrat brave - or foolhardy - enough to snort this pain-blocking Warp-powder will see the face of the Horned Rat himself.
Given sufficient exposure to Warpstone spun at burning speeds, damaged Skaven flesh can knit itself back together. But only briefly. Stand clear when the effect fades…
[[col:green]][[img:icon_spawning]][[/img]]Unlocks Blessed Spawnings: Blessed Terradon Riders (Fireleech Bolas)
[[col:green]][[img:icon_spawning]][[/img]]Unlocks Blessed Spawnings: Blessed Cold One Spear-Riders
[[col:green]][[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Unlocks a unique powerful Red Crested Skink Chief

Slitting the throats of their sleeping foes is one of the favoured nightly activities of all Eshin agents, useful for silently thinning out the ranks of enemy armies.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Damages an army for 10% of its current health.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Agent recovery time: 2 turns[[/col]]

Although rival Lords can be hard to kill, a sneaky knife in the dark can always cause grievous injury.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Wounds the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord of a targeted army.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Agent recovery time: 4 turns[[/col]]

Eshin's operatives are able to get into the most protected vaults, pulling off heists of unimaginable scale with surgical precision.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Steals up to {{tr:icon_money}}4000 from a settlement and reduces its income by 10% for 5 turns.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Agent recovery time: 4 turns\\n[[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Action cooldown time: 20 turns[[/col]]

Clan Eshin, though specialists in swift, sneaky deaths, are also able to sew discord amongst a population, mobilising its malcontents to run amuck.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Causes a rebellion in a settlement and reduces [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]control for 5 turns.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Agent recovery time: 2 turns[[/col]]

Infiltrating an army’s ranks and stealthily turning individuals against each other is every Eshin agent’s idea of a fun soiree.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Applies [[img:icon_effect_morale]][[/img]]leadership penalty to a targeted army:[[/col]]

Eshin's murderous agents do not merely kill their enemies, for they are skilled in a whole range of espionage techniques, even able to take over other Skaven settlements.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Grants ownership over a Skaven settlement.\\n(Excludes [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-Cities)[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Agent recovery time: 4 turns[[/col]]

Snikch delights most in taking a sovereign’s head and watching their denizens stagger to destruction without direction or purpose.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Snikch removes a faction’s leader, causing them to be overthrown by rebels. Select any army or settlement to target a faction.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Snikch recovery time: 5 turns\\n[[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Action cooldown time: 100 turns[[/col]]

To ensure the agents of Clan Eshin do not falter in their unending, deadly tasks, additional rations are set aside for those assigned to carry out their nefarious schemes.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Resets all used [[img:skv_snikch_schemes]]Schemes.\\n(No target required)[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Action cooldown time: 10 turns[[/col]]

Though bringing death by stealth is Snikch's chief concern, he is also capable of blowing his opponents’ sea-based hardware clean out of existence.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Snikch destroys an [[img:icon_transport_fleet]][[/img]]army on sea.\\n(Includes Black Arks)[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Snikch recovery time: 5 turns\\n[[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Action cooldown time: 50 turns[[/col]]

Snikch is a master arsonist, able to set fires that can rip right through an enemy city and leave nothing but ashes and charred bones in his terrible wake.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Snikch destroys all buildings in a settlement, leaving only the main settlement building behind.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Snikch recovery time: 5 turns\\n[[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Action cooldown time: 50 turns[[/col]]

Nightlord Sneek demands that his Chief Assassin periodically travels back to Skavenblight to report to him on Clan Eshin’s shady affairs, a trip that requires significant bribery and backstabbing for the Deathmaster to remain undetected.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]This action must be performed to complete Snikch’s campaign and increases the number of available [[img:skv_snikch_schemes]][[/img]]Schemes by 1.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Snikch recovery time: 2 turns[[/col]]

Nightlord Sneek demands that his Chief Assassin periodically travels back to Skavenblight to report to him on Clan Eshin’s shady affairs, a trip that requires significant bribery and backstabbing for the Deathmaster to remain undetected.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]This action must be performed to complete Snikch’s campaign and increases the number of available [[img:skv_snikch_schemes]][[/img]]Schemes by 1.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Snikch recovery time: 2 turns[[/col]]

Nightlord Sneek demands that his Chief Assassin periodically travels back to Skavenblight to report to him on Clan Eshin’s shady affairs, a trip that requires significant bribery and backstabbing for the Deathmaster to remain undetected.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]This action must be performed to complete Snikch’s campaign and increases the number of available [[img:skv_snikch_schemes]][[/img]]Schemes by 1.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Snikch recovery time: 2 turns[[/col]]

Nightlord Sneek demands that his Chief Assassin periodically travels back to Skavenblight to report to him on Clan Eshin’s shady affairs, a trip that requires significant bribery and backstabbing for the Deathmaster to remain undetected.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]This action must be performed to complete Snikch’s campaign and increases the number of available [[img:skv_snikch_schemes]][[/img]]Schemes by 1.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Snikch recovery time: 2 turns[[/col]]

Whisper-whisper to cause dissent in the ranks of the foe! Such sneakiness enables Eshin to take control of another Skaven army.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Grants ownership over a rival Skaven army. If led by a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Legendary Lord, they do not join your faction.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Agent recovery time: 4 turns[[/col]]

Eshin's sleeper agents enable the assassination clan to maintain constant streams of information to feed into their network of murder, even monitoring the Under-Empire below ground.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Grants vision of a province for 20 turns.\\n(Also reveals [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-Cities)[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Agent recovery time: 2 turns[[/col]]

Sabotage is possibly the most satisfying of the sneaky arts aside from murder, or at least so say the Eshin agents who watch their foes from suitable, hidden vantage points as they flounder around their utterly destroyed building.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Destroys the most expensive building in a settlement.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Agent recovery time: 2 turns[[/col]]

Underhanded sneaky-scouting of a province provides otherwise hidden information of what’s there, even detecting the presence of rival warrens.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Grants vision of a province for 5 turns.\\n(Also reveals [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-Cities)[[/col]]

Snikch has all sorts of heinous weapons at his disposal, including a virulent, incurable contagion that can cripple a land’s population for an extended period.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Snikch's contagion stops recruitment, reduces [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]growth and causes [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition to local forces in a province.\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Snikch recovery time: 5 turns\\n[[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Action cooldown time: 50 turns[[/col]]

To the light-clawed agents of Clan Eshin, who delight in all forms of sneakiness, even items and followers can be pilfered and added to their personal collection – call it a perk of the job, if you will.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Grants an ancillary or item from a settlement.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Action cooldown time: 10 turns[[/col]]

On occasion, Eshin agents must steal food from other settlements – even stone-cold, hardened killers need to eat, you know!\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Grants 5 [[img:icon_skaven_food]]food from a settlement.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Action cooldown time: 10 turns[[/col]]

Shiny-shiny things of desire! Gold, or any other currency for that matter, is fair game to the agents of Eshin, especially when their oblivious targets aren’t looking.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Steals up to {{tr:icon_money}}1000 from a settlement and reduces its income by 10% for 5 turns.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Action cooldown time: 10 turns[[/col]]

Amongst the Skaven, there's no such thing as getting ahead of Clan Eshin, whose eyes – and claws – are everywhere and nowhere at the same time.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Increases research rate by 20% for 5 turns. Additional applications increase effect duration.\\n(Targets Skaven settlements only)[[/col]]

No dwelling, above ground or beneath it, is beyond the reach of the ambitious Clan Eshin; even the lairs of other Skaven clans can be wrested from their claws by the sneakiest of means!\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Grants ownership over a rival Skaven [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-City.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:red]][[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Agent recovery time: 4 turns[[/col]]

Following the previous Council of Thirteen meeting in Skavenblight, Warlord Gnawdwell of Clan Mors has become suspicious of Clan Moulder. His coded missive requests Eshin’s services to spy on Moulder’s activities and report back to him.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Increases your reputation with Clan Mors in addition to granting [[img:icon_skaven_food]]food and {{tr:icon_treasury}}treasury.\\n\\n[[col:red]]Decreases your reputation with Clan Moulder\\n[[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Agent recovery time: 5 turns[[/col]]

Warlord Gnawdwell of Clan Mors has come out of the last Council meeting ever more distrustful of Clan Moulder’s intentions. His missive requests that Eshin’s operatives kidnap and deliver a Moulder Warlord to him for interrogation.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Increases your reputation with Clan Mors in addition to granting [[img:icon_skaven_food]]food and {{tr:icon_treasury}}treasury.\\n\\n[[col:red]]Decreases your reputation with Clan Moulder\\n[[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Agent recovery time: 5 turns[[/col]]

Another Council meeting has ended and Warlord Gnawdwell of Clan Mors is certain that Clan Moulder are attempting to undermine him. His missive demands that a senior Moulder Warlord be ‘taken out’ in the most brutal way possible.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Increases your reputation with Clan Mors in addition to granting [[img:icon_skaven_food]]food and {{tr:icon_treasury}}treasury.\\n\\n[[col:red]]Decreases your reputation with Clan Moulder\\n[[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]Agent recovery time: 5 turns[[/col]]

Every Moulder mutant sold to other clans comes with a carcass buy-back clause so Throt can ensure no genetic material goes to waste.
No self-respecting Master Mutator is without their own organ farm, with regular transplants keeping the fighting monsters in tip-top shape.
Though highly beneficial to him, Throt prefers not to waste his tasty Mutagen on himself if he can help it – the problem is, he often can’t!
With a bit of prodding from Throt’s things-catcher, the Throtlings hastily sweep up all battlefield specimens left behind by Moulder’s warmongering.
As the weak perish in a pool of genetic sludge, the strongest specimens endure, and Throt’s foul herd grows ever stronger.
The means to replicate the genetic sequence of the best fodder-troops also saves the considerable cost involved in augmenting them.
Those who fail to adequately serve Throt will end up as genetic goop to feed something infinitely more useful and horrible.
Growing test-tube monsters is an unpredictable business, so it is wise to have a contingency plan to enable the harvesting of any unforeseen results.
A monstrously sized walk-in refrigerator allows Mutagen (and other creature parts) to be stored at sub-zero temperatures in copious amounts.
Purging the mutagen of impurities and unwanted biological waste makes it easier for Throt to keep his genetic freaks in working order.
The only thing better than a steroid is a potent cocktail of several steroids mixed together to achieve more desirable results.
Throt’s obsession with growing nasty abominations can only be sated when the vat is large enough to match his twisted ambitions.

Execute some upstarts to set an example to the more timid Labourers.
Execute some upstarts to set an example to the more timid Labourers.
Send Labour to Zharr-Naggrund to be sacrificed in the name of the Dark Father, Hashut.
Send Labour to Zharr-Naggrund to be sacrificed in the name of the Dark Father, Hashut.
We have no more need for this Labour – let's fill our treasury rather than their bellies!
We have no more need for this Labour – let's fill our treasury rather than their bellies!
Armaments will see that the structure is strong enough to hold the large drill drill.
The structure is beyond measure, we will need as many Raw Materials as we can get our hands on.
To make sure this structure matches our standards, the drill requires a workforce and plenty of equipment.
He who gathers the coin may be creative with the accounting...
A master and instructor of novitiate Engineers can call in many favours.
A keen master of diplomats sends his envoys to those with ears open to his entreaties.
Machines may not work harder under their master's whip, but those who operate them will.
One who holds great leverage over the guilds of iron and of blood.
Maintaining the momentum is key to conquest, and only this seat can marshal the resources to keep an army pressing on.
Keeper of the keys to the armouries.
Warriors come from far and wide at the beckons of the Legate of Zharr.
Preeminent amongst his kind, the Cardinal Daemonsmith can make little count for much in the Hell-Forges.
A position of great esteem is held by one able to influence the winds of magic in Hashut's favour.
All flock to the Prophet of Hashut to garner even a scrap of his wisdom.
One who questions: "Why waste time turning lead to gold, when one can burn flesh to imbue metal with power?"
Master of builders and those who flog indolent workers.
A grand tycoon whose industrial prowess, and ability to shout loudly about it, has earned him his place.
A Lord of the Conclave would never smuggle goods for personal gain, at least not openly.
The master of savagely destructive powers must tear down blasphemous structures for new ones to be raised in the name of Hashut.
In times of need the holder of this seat can call up the hosts of Zharr to fight.
Mastering the art of sacrifice creates many bodies, but in perfecting it only the choicest are given to the fires.
One deeply invested in Hashut's mysteries must guard them jealously.
A position of great prestige, whom all others must respect.
Without the office of the High Commissioner an honest picture of labour numbers would be impossible.
The Procurator will take his cut. It is inevitable.
All must rally under the banners of Zharr.
They are called Ironsworn. Did you ever ask who they are sworn to?
This lord of Daemonsmiths holds the keys to unleashing the power of Hashut through a singular weapon.
Secure the wisdom of the Ironhand.
Subjugate the master of the Black Fortress.
Wrest the armies of Zhatan from his erstwhile master.

Tactical restructuring and Astromantic guidance combine to push Cathayan battlefield doctrine to the bleeding edge.
A firmer hand ensures the mortal courts remain aligned with the Dragon Emperor's grand design.
While a single Astromancer may nudge the hand of fate to make a blade strike true, the wrath of the Celestial Court can wed the sky and the earth itself.
No mortal being can deny a Dragon. Yuan Bo moves all pieces on the board as his own.
Bread to ready the stomach, steel to steady the heart.
One man and one woman from every village, and one soldier from every garrison.
Send their envoys away, fill their meeting chambers and audiences with our own. Our business shall be finished before their matters ever reach the table.
Cathay's finest artisans would not dare deny the Jade Dragon.
The oversight of a dedicated handler and the removal of budgetary concerns does wonders for ones work ethic.
A great Astromantic weaving allows the soldiers of Cathay to act with surety of purpose for a day and a night with clear minds and steady hands.
The calculus of war may demand a garrison strike as the blade instead of the shield.
By which one leverages the most powerful force ever conceived: compound interest.
A small sliver of the Wu Xing Compass' power can be directed precisely where needed, given the right motivation.
To be granted the title of Jade Master and tasked with a mandate is to be granted authority that even a Dragon would hesitate to question.
Consider it a lesson in negotiation. One always reads the fine print.
An unbreakable mask and an equally unbreakable rhetoric prevents any and all retort.
The Cult of Chi'an Chi is merely a facet of the deeper threats that Cathay faces. Root out conspirators and their ilk.
The Celestial Court is charged with combating the machinations of the Dark Gods, their agents some of the greatest Astromancers Cathay has ever produced.
A pick does not chop a tree, but a handle can always be repurposed.
A bit of extra oversight goes a long way to ensuring the carpenters spend their time on more critical matters.
The spirit of the great wall made anew, wherever the threat rises.
Sometimes the land itself is a prison, refusing to set its victims free.
If one stays fused to the earth long enough, one almost becomes part of the scenery.

Being perpetually haunted by the dead is no way to live.
Angry spirits descend on the unwary, desperate to be joined in death.
Some spells do little more than to inspire generosity among one's enemies.
Enthralled minds are often the most giving, impoverishing themselves to pay tribute to their master.
Corruption must be cleansed, wherever its infection spreads.
Where the land is purified by blinding light, corruption can no longer hold sway.
The armies of Kislev's enemies crumble, burdened by the darkest of magics.
Spreads Tzeentch corruption to a province via an army.

By channelling their magic, the Battle Wizard is able to temporarily unleash cataclysmic power.
Once fully attuned to their chosen lore, a Wizard loses their draw on the other Winds of Magic.
A loud roar echoes from the nearby forests, however your Amber Wizards do nothing by smile.
A purple cloud of death spreads through the surrounding area, leeching the life from all it may touch.
Bright Wizards often joke about having a key for every situation, they were only supposed to blow the bloody gates off
The Celestial Wizards in your forces foresaw your current prediciment and allowed you to plan your next steps accordingly.
A confusing but powerful Astrolabe that allows the user to read tomorrow's stars.
Otherwise known as "Trickster Wizards", the Grey Wizards place an illusionary veil over your forces, allowing you to strike unseen.
Wounds heal and sickness waines as the Life Wizards do their rounds, bringing the army back to full strength.
A sickle made from enchanted oak affords its wielder a strong affinity with the Winds of Ghyran.
A shimmering light coats each soldier, protecting them from harm as your Light Wizards finish their incantations.
A radiant orb of light protects the wearer of this amulet, reflecting projectiles back at the attacker.
Protective vestments worn by Balthazar Gelt following an alchemical experiment gone badly wrong.
The enemy's armour begins to buckle and warp under the Winds of Chamon, affording your troops plenty of openings.
A Gold Wizard is able to use their talents in many ways to help generate a small fortune.
A ceremonial blade turned deadly weapon by the power of Chamon.

Karl Franz orders the horns of war be sounded; the troops must be rallied!
While he would have hoped for a peaceful solution, the most Karl Franz can hope for now is to reduce the fallout of war.
We need more men and we need them now! Tell every man, woman or child who can wield a blade to take up arms! For the Empire!
Whether through military prowess or swindling at court, this general has been granted great rewards.
The Witch Hunters hear of nearby corruption and intend to spread their Purifying Flames.
In times of peace we must let the people migrate away from the more war-torn areas.
Count banners fly in unison as the Emperor lays claim to his finest forces.
The ground shakes to the beat of the drum as the troops march off to war. Let's hope they arrive in time!
The Empire must stay united, and who better to lead us than Emperor Karl Franz! For the Empire!
A volley of Amethyst Mortar shells rain from the sky. As each one explodes, the grim laugh of Bjuna is drowned out only by the screams of his dissolving victims.
Increase caps of Amethyst Land Ship
Increase caps of Amethyst Helstorm Rocket Battery
Weeks of magical infusion goes into creating each rocket. As such, the empire cannot afford to fire more than one of these at a time... Not that they'd need too...
A series of Amethyst infused rockets are fired towards a certain target, drawn to those with strong spirits, who will be devoured on detonation.

Grukmur knows the hidden ways. These secrets he will share with great Tamurkhan.\\n\\nThis ability has a 10 turn cooldown.
Whispers spread among the beasts, mutants and outcasts of the region. They heed to call to spread corruption.\\n\\nThis ability has a 10 turn cooldown.
Fill the damned ranks! It matters not with whom, just get them filled!\\n\\nThis ability has a 10 turn cooldown.\\n\\nThis ability has a 10 turn cooldown.

Only the truly insane push on after all reason and exhaustion tell them to stop. Such a leader can inspire his warriors' very sinews to move, and even their blood to pump, after all others are fit to collapse.\\n\\nThis ability has a 10 turn cooldown.
{{tr:land_units_onscreen_name_wh3_dlc25_nur_cha_exalted_hero_chieftain}} does not believe in rest, only in action.\\n\\nThis ability has a 10 turn cooldown.
The Winds of Magic blow in favour of Ketzak Fimdirach, while they howl wildly against his enemies, forcing them to find shelter.\\n\\nThis ability has a 10 turn cooldown.
You'd be afraid of a horde of monsters too, you know.\\n\\nThis ability has a 10 turn cooldown.
Kayzk's riders bring not only war, but also famine, disease and death!\\n\\nThis ability has a 10 turn cooldown.
Rot, glorious rot... More than enough to go around, in fact.\\n\\nThis ability has a 10 turn cooldown.
When the howls seem close but suddenly fall silent... that's when you should be truly afraid.\\n\\nThis ability has a 10 turn cooldown.
Claws chipped and ragged, buried in the guts of a hundred foes and encrusted with foulness beyond belief.\\n\\nThis ability has a 10 turn cooldown.

Work every single thrall to their last dying breath, squeeze every iota of worth from their pitiful existence!

Send your followers out into the mortal world. They will establish [[img:icon_cult]][[/img]]cults in up to 3 human or Elf-owned settlements.\\n\\n[[img:icon_cult]][[/img]]Cult buildings provide various benefits, and can allow you to increase your [[img:icon_seductive_influence]][[/img]]seductive influence over certain factions.

Send your disciples to seize control of this faction, turning them into a loyal [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassal. The target faction must have reached 100% [[img:icon_seductive_influence]][[/img]]seductive Influence. The total [[img:icon_seductive_influence]][[/img]]seductive influence required to reach this threshold depends on the target’s race and number of settlements.

Never have I been to such revels! The food delighted, the games we played, and there were so many wanton diversions.
